docs.title: Welcome to My MkDocs Sample Site
docs.text: This is a sample documentation site built with MkDocs by Joe Moore. MkDocs is a fast, simple and downright gorgeous static site generator that's geared towards building project documentation.

docs.title: What is MkDocs?
docs.text:
MkDocs is a tool for creating beautiful documentation websites from Markdown files. It features:

  • Simple: Write your documentation in Markdown, MkDocs builds the site
  • Fast: Build and serve your documentation locally in seconds
  • Beautiful: Use themes to customize the look and feel
  • Extensible: Add plugins and extensions for additional functionality

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text:
1. Install MkDocs: pip install mkdocs
  2. Create a new project: mkdocs new my-project
  3. Preview your site: mkdocs serve
  4. Build for production: mkdocs build

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Search: Built-in search functionality
  • Themes: Multiple themes available (Material, Read the Docs, etc.)
  • Plugins: Extend functionality with plugins
  • GitHub Integration: Automatic deployment to GitHub Pages

Pro Tip

Use mkdocs serve during development for live reloading of your documentation.

docs.title: API Reference
docs.text: This section provides detailed documentation for the project's API.

docs.title: Document
docs.text: The main document class for handling content.

docs.title: Document.__init__(title, content)
docs.text:
Initialize a new document.

Parameters:

  • title (str): The document title
  • content (str): The document content in Markdown format

Returns: Document instance

docs.title: Document.render()
docs.text:
Render the document to HTML.

Returns: str - The rendered HTML content

Example: 

doc = Document("My Doc", "# Hello World")
html = doc.render()
print(html)  # <h1>Hello World</h1>

Advanced Example with Superfences: document_processor.py

import markdown

class DocumentProcessor:
    def __init__(self, source_dir: str):
        self.source_dir = source_dir
        self.documents = []

    def process_all(self) -> list:
        """Process all documents in source directory"""
        for file_path in self._find_md_files():
            doc = self._load_document(file_path)
            self.documents.append(doc)
        return self.documents

    def _find_md_files(self) -> list:
        """Find all markdown files recursively"""
        # Implementation here...
        pass

    def _load_document(self, path: str) -> Document:
        """Load and parse a single document"""
        with open(path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f:
            content = f.read()
        return Document(path, content)

docs.text: The API provides comprehensive error handling:

docs.text:
• DocumentError: Raised when document processing fails
  • ThemeError: Raised when theme application fails
  • BuildError: Raised when site building fails

docs.title: Error Codes
docs.text: Code Description 1001 Invalid document format 1002 Missing required field 2001 Theme not found 2002 Theme configuration error 3001 Build directory not writable

docs.title: Basic Usage
docs.text:
from mkdocs import Document, Site

# Create a document
doc = Document("API Guide", "# API Documentation\n\nWelcome!")

# Create and build site
site = Site()
site.add_document(doc)
site.build()

docs.title: Advanced Configuration
docs.text:
from mkdocs import Site, Theme

# Custom theme
theme = Theme(
    name="custom",
    css=["custom.css"],
    js=["custom.js"]
)

# Site with custom theme
site = Site(theme=theme, config={
    'site_name': 'Advanced Docs',
    'plugins': ['search', 'minify']
})

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text: This guide will help you get up and running with your MkDocs documentation site.

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
First, make sure you have Python installed. Then install MkDocs:

pip install mkdocs

Note

If you have multiple Python versions, use python -m pip install mkdocs to ensure it's installed for the correct Python version.

docs.title: Creating a New Site
docs.text:
Create a new MkDocs project:

mkdocs new my-awesome-docs
cd my-awesome-docs

This creates a basic project structure:

my-awesome-docs/
├── docs/
│   └── index.md
└── mkdocs.yml

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
Edit mkdocs.yml to customize your site:

site_name: My Awesome Documentation
site_description: Documentation for my awesome project
theme:
  name: mkdocs

docs.title: Writing Documentation
docs.text:
Add your documentation files to the docs/ directory. Use Markdown formatting:

# My Page Title

This is some content.

## Section

More content here.

- List item 1
- List item 2

docs.title: Tabbed Content
docs.text:
Material for MkDocs supports tabbed content for organizing information:

InstallationConfigurationUsage 
# Install MkDocs
pip install mkdocs

# Install Material theme
pip install mkdocs-material

# mkdocs.yml
site_name: My Docs
theme:
  name: material

# Start development server
mkdocs serve

# Build for production
mkdocs build

docs.title: Serving Locally
docs.text:
Start the development server:

mkdocs serve

Your site will be available at http://localhost:8000 with live reloading.

docs.title: Building for Production
docs.text:
Build your site for deployment:

mkdocs build

This creates a site/ directory with your static files.

Pro Tip with Tabs

Choose your preferred programming language:

PythonJavaScriptTypeScript

Python is great for beginners and has excellent data science libraries.

    return f"Hello, {name}!"

print(greet("World"))
